node.title: What's it like to renovate in Antarctica? These expeditioners are about to find out
node.alt: Expeditioners hoist the Australian flag over an old wooden hut.
node.description: Below-freezing temperatures, gale force winds and penguins — it's what awaits expeditioners travelling to preserve the remains of Mawson's Huts in Antarctica.
node.content:
["On Friday, six expeditioners will set sail for Commonwealth Bay in Antarctica on the French icebreaker L'Astrolabe to spend six weeks restoring what remains of the historic Mawson's Huts.\u00a0", "The heritage-listed huts were\u00a0built by Antarctic expeditioner Douglas Mawson and his crew at Cape Denison\u00a0between 1911 and 1914, and housed a group of about\u00a032 men for a year when they missed being picked up by their relief vessel.", "But restoring what is considered the most significant Australian historical site in Antarctica will be unlike typical home renovations or outdoor projects.", "Expeditioners will sleep in a demountable\u00a0known as the Sorensen Hut, go to the toilet in a bucket so everything can be containerised,\u00a0and spend their days working in minus-20 degrees\u00a0Celsius while battling gale force winds and\u00a0blizzard-like\u00a0conditions.\u00a0", "", "
Expeditioner Michelle Berry examines the living section of Mawson's Hut in 2015.(Supplied: David Killick)
", "\"The main job will be to do a bit of a health check on Mawson's Huts,\" said Greg Carter,\u00a0chief executive of the Mawson's Huts Foundation.\u00a0", "\"They were built\u00a0to last six months\u00a0and they're still there 110 years later. The team will be doing\u00a0things like cutting out the ice that's inside the hut, maintaining\u00a0the timbers, and conserving all the artefacts that we find there.\u00a0", "\"There's always new artefacts found as well as the ones we know about.", "Other jobs include setting up an automatic weather station and counting the number of penguins living in colonies around the huts.\u00a0", "", "
Expeditioners will work to remove ice and snow that settles in the old huts.(Supplied: David Killick)
", "
Accessing history not without challenges
", "If the group manages to get to Cape Denison, it will be the first time restoration work has been carried out on the huts since 2015.\u00a0", "\"There was a big iceberg called B19B, which was the size of the ACT, which blocked the entrance to Commonwealth Bay, but that's broken up a bit now,\" Mr Carter said of the most recent voyage.\u00a0", "'Fast ice', or ice that is fastened to the continent, could also prove a challenge for the expeditioners.", "\"At the moment [fast ice] covers about 23 kilometres, so they'll probably have to be taken to the [work site] by helicopter,\" Mr Carter said.", "", "
Chief conservator Ian Godfrey removes ice from shelves inside Mawson's cubicle during the 2015 expedition.(Supplied: David Killick)
", "Four of the expeditioners have been to Antarctica several times previously \u2014 including Mercury newspaper reporter David Killick, who will serve as the base camp manager, and take on the responsibility of cooking for the crew.\u00a0", "It will be a maiden voyage for materials conservators Karina Acton and Eoin\u00a0O'Suilleabhain.", "\"I'm really excited, definitely a bit nervous ... I didn't\u00a0think I would ever go to Antarctica in my life,\" Ms Acton said.", "", "
Mawson's Hut had simple living and dining quarters.(Supplied: David Killick)
", "Ms Acton said planning for the voyage first began in March, but she was only confirmed as an expeditioner last week.", "\"Our permits came through to enter Tasmania last Thursday ... we've been planning for it most of this year, but not having any certainty until a few days ago,\" she said.", "\"It's six weeks on the ice, and a week travelling there and back, so it will be eight weeks out of our day-to-day lives.\"", "The travel means the expeditioners will spend Christmas and New Year's away from their families \u2014 but plans have\u00a0been made for their own Antarctic festivities.\u00a0", "", "
Several artefacts from Mawson's time in Antarctica remain in the huts.(Supplied: David Killick)
", "
Conservation works 'integral' to preserve history
", "The team will benefit from Antarctica's 24 hours of\u00a0daylight but will face unpredictable weather conditions.", "\"On previous trips we've faced winds of over 100 kilometres an hour, blizzards that went for days and temperatures down to minus 20 [degrees],\" expedition leader Marty Passingham said.", "", "
Mawson's work during his Antarctic expedition\u00a0is still used by scientists today.(AAP: Australian Antarctic Division)
", "The huts\u00a0don't get many visitors, but Mr Carter said their place in Antarctic history makes them\u00a0worth the effort.\u00a0", "\"Mawson was really special in that his expedition to the Antarctic was the first truly scientific voyage to Antarctica,\" he\u00a0said.", "\"A lot of the other guys around at that time,\u00a0Shackleton and Scott and Amundsen,\u00a0were all trying to be the first to the south pole, it was about glory-hunting.", "\"Mawson was a scientist, he was a geologist, and a lot of the weather records he took down there are still used in [climate] modelling today, so it's really current, what he did 110 years ago.\"", "The expedition will be documented on the Mawson's Huts Foundation\u00a0Facebook page."]
